title: Chili
directions: Drain beans, reserving liquid; set aside. Heat oil in a medium heavy-bottomed saucepot over medium-high heat. Add beef, onions, and garlic; cook until browned, breaking up meat with a wooden spoon, about 10 minutes. Stir in diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, chili powder, and cumin. Bring tomato mixture to a boil, reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, until sauce thickens, stirring occasionally, about 1 hour.
Stir beans into meat mixture. Cook until heated through, about 10 minutes more. Stir in Adobo and sugar. Divide chili evenly among serving bowls.
ingredients: 2 tbsp. GOYAÂ® Extra Virgin Olive Oil
1 tsp. GOYA Minced Garlic, or 2 cloves garlic, finely chopped
2 cans (15.5 oz. each) GOYA Red Kidney Beans, rinsed and drained
